instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message:
This board came in with no light on charger. Liquid at <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>, which I replaced and 3.4v came back. PPBUS = 8.6. More liquid at <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>, replaced and <CAPACITOR>C7400</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7425</CAPACITOR>, resoldered <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> as pin 12 had a tiny bit of corrosion on it.

The boards now gets green and orange light, I have 3.3v and a 5.1v pulse at <CAPACITOR>C7518</CAPACITOR>. PPVRTC = 3.3v. On <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> I got 3.3v and area looks clean. <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> has 3.4v and <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> pulses at 3.3v but goes to 0. CPU Vcore also pulses. I cannot find any shorts. I did replace <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> but situation is the same. <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> has 32mhz clock. Ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message:
Pin3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pulses too?
Try new BIOS clean ME.
And check for corroded component, or trace.
Put good flux and heat SMC and CPU; no more than 180-200 degrees.
You may need to ultrasonic too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message: What tool would you recommend for cleaning ROM ME region?
